To: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>
CC: Matthew McDaid <matthew.mcdaid@aon.ae>; Maher Sammak <Maher.Sammak@aon.ae>; Subramaniam Iyer <subramaniam.iyer@aon.com>

تم إرسال هذا البريد الإلكتروني من خارج مجموعة شلهوب. لا تنقر على الروابط أو تفتح المرفقات إلا إذا كنت تعرف المرسل وتعلم أنه آمن


Dear Hagop,

I hope this message finds you well.

It was a pleasure introducing the Aon team to Chalhoub, our professional relationship aside it was important to emphasize that as Aon we view Chalhoub as a strategic partner, and so are grateful for the opportunity to quote and participate in your PV and Commercial Crime programs, as well as for the chance to introduce the team to you and meet Joe.

chunks.text:
It was a pleasure introducing the Aon team to Chalhoub, our professional relationship aside it was important to emphasize that as Aon we view Chalhoub as a strategic partner, and so are grateful for the opportunity to quote and participate in your PV and Commercial Crime programs, as well as for the chance to introduce the team to you and meet Joe.

During our presentation, we highlighted our terms and coverage enhancements (in blue), where awarding the PV on an individual basis would provide a 10% price saving. Furthermore, if both PV and Commercial Crime are awarded together, the savings would increase to 15%. We were hoping to receive an indication of the award price for both lines so that we could rework a combined offer. However, if we are to proceed with individual assessments, please find attached the revised offer for PV, which includes two options: one with Terrorism Liability and one without.

 

All subjectivities have been listed in the attached report, to be complied with at the binding stage.  As you’re aware, you will also need to comply with the KYC requirement pursuant to the CBUAE regulations, that too is captured in the “introduction” section of the attached report.

 

Regarding the Commercial Crime coverage, we require some additional information to finalize our negotiations with underwriters for further discounts. I appreciate that you’ve provided this before, but for clarity and completeness, I would be grateful if you could confirm the following details as we discussed:

metadata.doc_id: CBJ9QCW - request for competitive quotations fidelity insurance & political violence policy - chalhoub group\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CBJ9QCW - request for competitive quotations fidelity insurance & political violence policy - chalhoub group\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
Regarding the Commercial Crime coverage, we require some additional information to finalize our negotiations with underwriters for further discounts. I appreciate that you’ve provided this before, but for clarity and completeness, I would be grateful if you could confirm the following details as we discussed:



1.	Confirmation the Insured are not trading with or supporting any of the Russian or Belarus banks, Individuals or companies that have bene sanctioned following the conflict in Ukraine? 
2.	Confirmation of no material changes in the risk exposure, as on the date of binding?
3.	Copy of the fully completed, signed, dated & stamped Commercial Crime proposal form along with fully completed, signed, dated & stamped Impersonation Fraud supplemental questionnaire?
4.	The client to re-confirm that the Loss record for the preceding 3 years – few incidents of theft by employees in stores, with each incident not exceeding AED 50,000?
5.	Following on from item 4, policyholder to confirm the details of the precautionary measures taken to avoid such losses in the future?

 


Thank you again, Hagop, for the opportunity to work with you, and we look forward to your feedback.

 

Kind Regards, 

MG

 

Kind regards,

Mohammad Galadari 

 

Mohammad Galadari

Director – Business Development

t +971 4 202 6114  m +971 50 8091629

mohammad.galadari@aon.com <mailto:mohammad.galadari@aon.com>

Dear Mohammad,

 

I hope this message finds you well. It was a pleasure meeting the Aon team.

 

Following our last meeting, please submit the final proposal for the Political Violence policy by the end of the day on Wednesday, September 25, 2024. It is essential that the proposal includes comprehensive terms and conditions for a thorough review. We plan to finalize the award by Friday, September 27, 2024.

Following our last meeting, please submit the final proposal for the Political Violence policy by the end of the day on Wednesday, September 25, 2024. It is essential that the proposal includes comprehensive terms and conditions for a thorough review. We plan to finalize the award by Friday, September 27, 2024.

 

For the Commercial Crime proposal, the submission deadline is Wednesday, October 9, 2024, with the award decision by Friday, October 11, 2024. If you need any further information, please request it well before the submission date.

 

As evident from the timelines, submit your best and final terms, as there will be no second round of negotiation.

 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

Good morning, Hagop, 

 

I hope you’re enjoying your annual break and getting some well-deserved rest. 

 

Thank you for the opportunity to work on the requests below. I am pleased to inform you that we have started to approach the market and exploring some coverage enhancements (as an alternative option)

 

I have attached the JB proposal form for your reference. When you have a moment, it would be helpful if you could provide some information on the expiring policy schedule. This will allow us to better understand the necessary extensions and coverage requirements, as well as the target premium. This information will help us determine whether to involve our local or international colleagues.

Fidelity Insurance

I hope this email finds you well.

 

I’m reaching out to request quotations for two policies: Fidelity Insurance and Political Violence (PV) Insurance. Please find the relevant details below:

 

Fidelity Insurance

 

*	Attachments: I’ve attached the completed proposal form, along with the employee headcount and the related entities to be covered.
*	Incident History: In 2019, we had a major claim in KSA involving SAR 930,000 in stolen stock by warehouse employees. Since then, we’ve implemented stricter security measures. Additionally, we’ve had a few smaller incidents of cash theft by store employees, with relatively minor amounts ranging from AED 20,000 to AED 50,000.
*	Existing Policies: I’ve also attached details of our current policies for your reference.

 

Political Violence (PV) Insurance

 

*	Full Sum Insured: Details of the full sum insured are attached.
*	Loss History: The PV loss history is clean, with no incidents to report.
*	Coverage for New Locations: We have over 500 locations, so it’s important to establish a method for covering new locations without requiring declarations each time. I’d like to discuss and agree on the most effective approach for this.
*	Existing Policies: I’ve also attached details of our current policies for your reference.

 

Next Steps

*	Full Sum Insured: Details of the full sum insured are attached.
*	Loss History: The PV loss history is clean, with no incidents to report.
*	Coverage for New Locations: We have over 500 locations, so it’s important to establish a method for covering new locations without requiring declarations each time. I’d like to discuss and agree on the most effective approach for this.
*	Existing Policies: I’ve also attached details of our current policies for your reference.

 

Next Steps

 

*	Quotation Timeline: Let’s aim to finalize both quotations by September 9. This will give us sufficient time to complete the necessary KYCs and issue the policies.
*	Meeting Availability: If you need access to a specific market or wish to discuss the method for covering new locations, we can schedule a meeting next week. Although I’m currently on leave, I remain available for work-related matters.

 

Confidentiality

 

Please note that all provided information remains confidential and is to be used solely for obtaining quotations from relevant entities.

 

Additional Request

 

Could you please resend the Jeweler’s Block proposal form? I can’t find it in my Outlook. If you need a proposal form filled out for the PV policy, kindly send it over, and I’ll provide the necessary details.

 

Future Opportunities

 

If your quotations are competitive and you can offer a compelling package, I’m prepared to consider placing the Christofle portfolio with you as well assuming that you will deliver a more competitive package both in terms of cost and quality of service.

Dear Hagop,

I hope this message finds you well.

It was a pleasure introducing the Aon team to Chalhoub, our professional relationship aside it was important to emphasize that as Aon we view Chalhoub as a strategic partner, and so are grateful for the opportunity to quote and participate in your PV and Commercial Crime programs, as well as for the chance to introduce the team to you and meet Joe.

chunks.text:
It was a pleasure introducing the Aon team to Chalhoub, our professional relationship aside it was important to emphasize that as Aon we view Chalhoub as a strategic partner, and so are grateful for the opportunity to quote and participate in your PV and Commercial Crime programs, as well as for the chance to introduce the team to you and meet Joe.

During our presentation, we highlighted our terms and coverage enhancements (in blue), where awarding the PV on an individual basis would provide a 10% price saving. Furthermore, if both PV and Commercial Crime are awarded together, the savings would increase to 15%. We were hoping to receive an indication of the award price for both lines so that we could rework a combined offer. However, if we are to proceed with individual assessments, please find attached the revised offer for PV, which includes two options: one with Terrorism Liability and one without.

 

All subjectivities have been listed in the attached report, to be complied with at the binding stage.  As you’re aware, you will also need to comply with the KYC requirement pursuant to the CBUAE regulations, that too is captured in the “introduction” section of the attached report.

 

Regarding the Commercial Crime coverage, we require some additional information to finalize our negotiations with underwriters for further discounts. I appreciate that you’ve provided this before, but for clarity and completeness, I would be grateful if you could confirm the following details as we discussed:

Regarding the Commercial Crime coverage, we require some additional information to finalize our negotiations with underwriters for further discounts. I appreciate that you’ve provided this before, but for clarity and completeness, I would be grateful if you could confirm the following details as we discussed:



1.	
	Confirmation the Insured are not trading with or supporting any of the Russian or Belarus banks, Individuals or companies that have bene sanctioned following the conflict in Ukraine?


      Confirmed


2.	
	Confirmation of no material changes in the risk exposure, as on the date of binding?


      Confirmed


3.	
	Copy of the fully completed, signed, dated & stamped Commercial Crime proposal form along with fully completed, signed, dated & stamped Impersonation Fraud supplemental questionnaire?


      Attached


4.	
	The client to re-confirm that the Loss record for the preceding 3 years – few incidents of theft by employees in stores, with each incident not exceeding AED 50,000?


      We have had one cases of theft of cash from the stores in UAE with and amount AED 25-30k. (The incident was closed as no claim as the amount was below AED 50k) 
      We had two cases of theft from petty cash in KSA with an average amount stolen of SAR 70k each incident. (The incident was closed as no claim as the amount was below AED 50k after reduction of the end of service gratuity)
     

5.	
	Following on from item 4, policyholder to confirm the details of the precautionary measures taken to avoid such losses in the future?

metadata.doc_id: CBJ9QCW - request for competitive quotations fidelity insurance & political violence policy - chalhoub group\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CBJ9QCW - request for competitive quotations fidelity insurance & political violence policy - chalhoub group\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
We have had one cases of theft of cash from the stores in UAE with and amount AED 25-30k. (The incident was closed as no claim as the amount was below AED 50k) 
      We had two cases of theft from petty cash in KSA with an average amount stolen of SAR 70k each incident. (The incident was closed as no claim as the amount was below AED 50k after reduction of the end of service gratuity)
     

5.	
	Following on from item 4, policyholder to confirm the details of the precautionary measures taken to avoid such losses in the future?


      For stores, the amount of cash transactions have decreased over time and yet we still do cash collections around twice a week using security companies. Most safes at the store are drop-in safes and for large stores, there is a separation of access, one person in charge in possession of the safe key and another who is entrusted with the combination codes.

      As for the petty cash, in KSA, all personnel who handle cash have family who sign off that any money stolen by their right of kin, they will be personally held responsible for. Also, we have reduced the petty cash limit available at the main offices to less than SAR 50,000 at any one point and have increased the number of internal checks and audits. The employees have been removed and 

 


Thank you again, Hagop, for the opportunity to work with you, and we look forward to your feedback.

 

Kind Regards,

MG

 

Kind regards,

Mohammad Galadari

 

Mohammad Galadari

Director – Business Development

ALERT: This message originated outside of Aon's network. BE CAUTIOUS before clicking any link or attachment.

 

Dear Mohammad,

 

I hope this message finds you well. It was a pleasure meeting the Aon team.

 

Following our last meeting, please submit the final proposal for the Political Violence policy by the end of the day on Wednesday, September 25, 2024. It is essential that the proposal includes comprehensive terms and conditions for a thorough review. We plan to finalize the award by Friday, September 27, 2024.

 

For the Commercial Crime proposal, the submission deadline is Wednesday, October 9, 2024, with the award decision by Friday, October 11, 2024. If you need any further information, please request it well before the submission date.

 

As evident from the timelines, submit your best and final terms, as there will be no second round of negotiation.

 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

‑
